issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

components.name: client
components.description: Code for submitting and monitoring jobs

fields.description:
org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.lib.input.SequenceFileRecordReader extends org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.RecordReader which in turn implements java.io.Closeable.

According to java spec the java.io.Closeable#close() has to be idempotent (http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/Closeable.html) which is not.

An NPE is being thrown if close() method is invoked without previously calling initialize() method. This happens because SequenceFile.Reader in is null.
fields.summary: SequenceFileRecordReader NPE if close() is called before initialize()

comments.body: Thanks for reporting this issue, [~reinis_v]. I could reproduce the issue. Attached patch fixes it.

Thanks [~ozawa] for taking this issue. The fix looks good to me. One comment: Would you create a new test case to verify the fix instead of adding the code in the existing test case?
